english: I like funny guys.

japanese: 子供でも飲める酔い止めが欲しいんですけど。
english: I'd like some motion sickness medicine for children.

japanese: 困ったことがあったら言ってね。私にできることなら何でもやるから。
english: If you ever get into a jam, let me know. I'll do whatever I can for you.

japanese: トムはハンカチで額を拭った。
english: Tom wiped his forehead with a handkerchief.

japanese: 「滞在の目的はなんですか？」「ギバン村でのボランティア活動に参加するためです」
english: "What's the purpose of your stay?" "It is to participate in the volunteer activity held by the village of Giban."

japanese: 努力すること自体には何の意味もないんだよ。結果を出さないと。
english: Effort for effort’s sake is meaningless. That effort must produce results.

japanese: 「トムの将来の夢は？」「僕、主夫になりたい」
english: "Tom, what's your dream for the future?" "I want to become a stay-at-home dad."

japanese: 昨日トムと話してて、プログラミングに興味あるって言ったら Python っていう言語薦められたんだけど、メアリー知ってる？
english: I was talking to Tom yesterday, and when I told him I was interested in programming he recommended Python to me. Mary, do you know anything about it?

japanese: 分かってないなあ。そんなこと言ったら女の子は傷つくに決まってんじゃん。
english: You don't get it. If you say stuff like that, you're bound to hurt the girl's feelings.

japanese: バイバイ。また遊ぼうね！
english: Bye! Let's do this again!

japanese: 「トム地震のとき起きてた？」「え、地震あったの？」「うん、1時半すぎ。けっこう大きな揺れだったよ」「まじか。普通に爆睡してたわ」
english: "Tom, were you awake during the earthquake?" "What, there was an earthquake?" "Yes, it was a little after 1:30. It was a fairly large tremor." "Really? I slept through it just like normal."

japanese: 大学なんて時間の無駄だ。
english: University is a waste of time.

japanese: 大学なんてさ、時間の無駄遣いだよ。
english: University is a waste of time.

japanese: 「ごめんね、ちょっと迷っちゃって」「大丈夫、私も今来たから」
english: "Sorry again for getting a little lost." "It's fine, I just got here too."

japanese: ドイツ語がいいならドイツ語で話してもいいよ。
english: Feel free to speak German.

japanese: トムはプログラミングのプの字も知らない。
english: Tom doesn't know the first thing about programming.

japanese: これ、日本のお土産です。気に入っていただけるといいのですが。
english: Here, this is a Japanese souvenir. I hope you like it.

japanese: トムは日本で買ってきた炊飯器を愛用している。
english: Tom always uses the rice cooker that he brought back from Japan.

japanese: これは扇子といって、こうやって開くんです。夏の暑い日に使うんです。
english: This is a folding fan, and this is how you open it. It's for hot summer days.

japanese: 怒りが爆発する前に、ガス抜きしなきゃ。
english: I have to let off some steam before I explode with anger.

japanese: こちらの本は、日本でよく売れてるんですよ。
english: This book sells well in Japan.

japanese: この本は、日本で売れ行きがいい。
english: This book sells well in Japan.

japanese: 「ケーキはもうないの？」「二つとも食べちゃった」
english: "There are no more cakes?" "I ate both of them."

japanese: その靴、外に干しといて！
english: Air out those shoes!

japanese: 笑ってるの？
english: Are you smiling?

japanese: トムはメアリーと話がしたかったんだ。
english: Tom wanted to speak with Mary.

japanese: 彼女は鉢から花を摘んで、私にくれました。
english: She picked a flower from the pot and gave it to me.

japanese: 彼女は植木鉢の花を採って、私にくれました。
english: She picked a flower from the pot and gave it to me.

japanese: こんなかわいい猫初めて見た。
english: I've never seen a cat this cute before.

japanese: 週末までに仕上げなきゃならない仕事が3つもあるんだよ。
english: I have 3 projects that I need to finish up by the weekend!

japanese: レンタカーです。
english: It's a rented car.

japanese: 「コーヒー入れるけど飲む？」「ありがとう。牛乳多めでお願いしてもいい？」
english: "I'm going to make some coffee. Do you want any?" "Yes, thank you. Could you make mine with a little more milk?"

japanese: 僕らはみんな、違う世界で生きています。
english: We all live in different worlds.

japanese: 皆、住む世界が違います。
english: We all live in different worlds.

japanese: 「作ってくれたおにぎり美味しかったよ」「あたたかいカップスープとかも持って行ったらもっと良かったね。今度はそうしようね」
english: "The onigiri you made me tasted great." "It would've been even better if you took a warm cup soup with you. Let's do that next time."

japanese: トムって変な笑い方するよね。
english: Tom has a funny way of laughing, doesn't he?

japanese: 低刺激性のクリームですので、敏感肌の方にも安心してお使いいただけます。
english: It's a hypoallergenic cream, so even those with sensitive skin can use it without worry.

japanese: 将棋でもやる？
english: Do you want to play shogi?

japanese: 「映画面白かった？」「うん、まじ最高だった。爆笑しすぎて腹痛くなったよ」
english: "Was the film funny?" "Yeah, it was amazing! I was laughing so hard my stomach hurt!"

japanese: 当店の水は浄水器を使用しています。
english: This store uses a water filter.

japanese: 前回お配りした資料をお持ちでない方はいらっしゃいますか？
english: Is there anyone who doesn't have the documents I handed out last time?

japanese: すみません、前通ります。
english: Excuse me, I'm coming through.

japanese: 私には東京に住む友達がいます。
english: I have a friend who lives in Tokyo.

japanese: トムはあした来るかな。
english: I wonder if Tom will come tomorrow.

japanese: トムはこのやり方、知ってるのかしら。
english: I wonder if Tom would know how to do this.

japanese: トムはコートを脱いでクローゼットに掛けました。
english: Tom took off his coat and hung it in the closet.

japanese: 何か言ってやりたかったけど、言わなかった。
english: I wanted to say something to him, but I didn't.

japanese: うれし涙が彼女の頬を伝った。
english: Tears of happiness streamed down her cheeks.

japanese: 「そちらでの生活は慣れましたか？」「そうですねぇ。まだまだですね。若干引きこもり気味です」
english: ”Have you gotten used to the life there?” ”Well, not yet. I'm kind of a homebody."

japanese: もっと話せるようになったら、もっと友達が増えるんじゃないかと思うと頑張れるよ。
english: I'm doing my best to get better at speaking, since I think the better I get, the more friends I can make.

japanese: ちょっと遊びすぎたから、仕事がたまってきちゃった。締め切りまでに間に合うか心配だよ。
english: I goofed off a bit much and work started piling up. I'm worried I might not make the deadline.

japanese: ボーイスカウトになったのはいつぐらい？
english: When did you become a Boy Scout?

japanese: 今は安全な場所にいます。
english: We're in a safe place now.

japanese: トムは３列目に座った。
english: Tom sat in the third row.

japanese: 今日は海がかなり荒れてるよ。
english: The sea is pretty rough today.

japanese: うちの屋根ね、雨漏りしてるの。
english: The roof of our house is leaking.

japanese: 晩ご飯、取っといてね。
english: Save dinner for me.

japanese: マフラーをしなさい。外は寒いわ。
english: Put your scarf on. It's cold out.

japanese: これは金庫にしまっておいてください。
english: Please put this in the safe.

japanese: 飼い犬が逃げた。
english: My dog ran away.

japanese: 砂の上に寝転がろうよ。
english: Let's lie on the sand.

japanese: 聞き流しなさい。そんなの噂にすぎません。
english: Ignore it. It's only a rumor.

japanese: 無視しとき。ただの噂でしょ。
english: Ignore it. It's only a rumor.

japanese: スルーしな。単なる噂じゃん。
english: Ignore it. It's only a rumor.

japanese: あなたが戻ってくるまで、ここにちゃんといますよ。
english: I'll stay right here until you get back.

japanese: 口の上を火傷しちゃった。
english: I burned the roof of my mouth.

japanese: 上あごを火傷したんだ。
english: I burned the roof of my mouth.

japanese: 海からどれぐらい離れてるの？
english: How far are we from the sea?

japanese: 定規で線を書いて。
english: Draw a line with a ruler.

japanese: さしを使って線を書いて。
english: Draw a line with a ruler.

japanese: 物差しを使って線を引きなさい。
english: Draw a line with a ruler.

japanese: サドルなしで乗れるの？
english: Can you ride without a saddle?

japanese: 世界を救えるのはお前だけだ！
english: You are the only one who can save the world.

japanese: どこか痛いの？
english: Does it hurt anywhere?

japanese: トムは怒り始めた。
english: Tom started to get angry.

japanese: この部屋、めちゃ暑いね。
english: It's very hot in this room.

japanese: 本当にそう思ってるの？
english: Do you really think so?

japanese: 本当にそう思う？
english: Do you really think so?

japanese: 明日って、仕事休める？
english: Can you get off work tomorrow?

japanese: トムはただ帰りたいだけだ。
english: Tom just wants to leave.

japanese: 5歳の時に自分で靴ひもを結べるようになった。
english: I learned to tie my shoelaces by myself at the age of five.

japanese: 靴紐は、5歳の時に一人で結べるようになりました。
english: I learned to tie my shoelaces by myself at the age of five.

japanese: 車でメアリー宅に向かう途中、トムはボストンを経由することになるだろう。
english: Tom will be driving through Boston on his way to visit Mary.

japanese: 迎えに来て。
english: Come pick me up.

japanese: その帽子、よく似合ってますよ。
english: That hat looks good on you.

japanese: トムって本当に顔がいいよね？
english: Tom is really handsome, isn't he?

japanese: ニュースを鵜呑みにするな。
english: Don't believe everything you hear on the news.

japanese: ここは入口ではありません。
english: This is not the entrance.

japanese: 「きゃっ！」「どうしたの、いきなり？」「何か落ちてきた」
english: "Ahhhh!" "What's with you all a sudden?" "Something fell."

japanese: 足元に何か落ちてますよ。
english: Something has fallen by your feet.

japanese: お金がないといい教育が受けられないのっておかしいと思う。
english: I think it's unfair that you can't receive a good education if you're poor.

japanese: あの、帽子落とされましたよ。
english: Um, you dropped your hat.

japanese: その辺に何か落ちてこなかった？
english: Did something fall down around there?

japanese: 限りある水資源を大切にしましょう。
english: Let's conserve our limited water supply.

japanese: 「何もしてあげられなくてごめんね」「ううん、いてくれるだけでいいの」
english: "Sorry I couldn't do anything for you." "Don't worry about it. You being here for me is more than enough."

japanese: 僕はチームで仕事をするのが得意なんです。
english: I'm good at working with a team.

english: I need to find somebody who can babysit on Friday nights.

japanese: 君の部屋が気に入ってるんだ。
english: I like your room.

japanese: あなたの部屋好きよ。
english: I like your room.

japanese: カスタマーサービス担当者とお話しになりたい方は、3を押してください。
english: If you would like to speak to a customer service representative, please press three.

japanese: 死ぬまでにあと1回はボストンに行きたい。
english: I'd like to visit Boston at least one more time before I die.

japanese: 死ぬまでにあと1回ボストンに行きたい。
english: I'd like to visit Boston at least one more time before I die.

japanese: メアリーの彼氏の名前って、トムよ。
english: Mary's boyfriend's name is Tom.

japanese: ネットに繋がらなかった。
english: I couldn't connect to the network.

japanese: 今は新しい人を雇うことが出来ない。
english: We can't hire anyone new right now.

japanese: 外国語を学ぶには、その言語が話されている国に住むのが一番だ。
english: The best way to learn a foreign language is to go live in a country where it's spoken.

japanese: カスタマーセンターに電話したら？
english: Why don't you call customer service?

japanese: 二人ともありがとう。
english: Thanks to both of you.

japanese: 私の知る限り、そのような機能はないと思います。
english: As far as I know, such a function doesn't exist.

japanese: 教えてもらったサイト、すごく面白くて役に立ちました。
english: The website you told me about was very interesting and also useful.

japanese: 一日何時間寝てる？
english: How many hours a day do you sleep?

japanese: ボストンに住めたらなあ。
english: I wish I could live in Boston.

japanese: すみません、通ります。
english: Excuse me, I'm coming through.

japanese: 週に最低3時間はフランス語の勉強をしています。

english: Instead of saying up-front that you can't do it, maybe you could try challenging yourself.

japanese: いつでも来ていいよ。
english: Come anytime you like.

japanese: お前なんかに俺の気持ちが分かるもんか！
english: How could someone like you understand what I'm feeling!

japanese: もっと普通の子に生まれたかった。
english: I wish I was born a normal kid.

english: At that hospital, even if you've got an appointment you have to wait at least two hours, so be ready for that.

japanese: 気持ちは分かるけど焦りは禁物だよ。
english: I understand how you must be feeling but remember that haste makes waste.

english: This is all I can do for now.

english: You broke the table you were sitting on.

japanese: あなたは座っていたテーブルを壊しました。
english: You broke the table you were sitting on.

japanese: 僕もときどき、どんなに頑張っても無駄なんじゃないかって思うことはあるよ。
english: I too have moments sometimes where I think I'm useless no matter how hard I try.

japanese: 勉強なんかできたって社会に出て何の役に立つんだよ。

japanese: 今日はいっぱい歩いたね。足疲れてない？
english: We walked a lot today. Are your legs tired?

japanese: このやり方、誰に教えてもらったの？
english: Who taught you how to do this?

japanese: トムはメアリーの視線に気づいてにっこりと笑った。
english: Tom noticed Mary's look and cracked a smile.

japanese: この物語は実話に基づいています。
english: This story is based on a true story.

japanese: この作品はフィクションです。実在の人物・団体等とは一切関係ありません。
english: This work is fiction. It has no relationship with any real persons, organizations, etc.

japanese: 羨ましがるだろうな。
english: You'll be jealous.

japanese: 地球はオレンジのような形状です。
english: The earth is shaped like an orange.

japanese: 事故の背景には、深刻な人手不足がある。
english: A severe shortage of workers was the cause of the accident.

japanese: 身分証明書をお願いします。
english: May I see your ID?

japanese: 鳥小屋を作ってるんだ。
english: I'm building a birdhouse.

japanese: トムは洗濯をしている。
english: Tom is doing the laundry.

japanese: トムは洗濯中だ。
english: Tom is doing the laundry.

japanese: トムはメアリーに、自分の切手コレクションを見せた。
english: Tom showed Mary his stamp collection.

japanese: 若いからってあんまり無理しちゃだめだよ。
english: Just because you're young doesn't mean you should be exerting yourself that much.

japanese: こちらにどなたかお医者様はいらっしゃいませんか？
english: Is anyone here a doctor?

japanese: 誰か警備員を呼べる？
english: Can someone call security?

japanese: どなたかセキュリティに連絡できますか？
english: Can someone call security?

japanese: 誰か警備員を呼んだ？
english: Did anybody call for security?

japanese: どなたかセキュリティを呼びましたか？
english: Did anybody call for security?

japanese: 食堂がまだ開いてるかどうか、誰か知ってる？
english: Does anybody know if the cafeteria is still open?

japanese: 事の次第について、誰かがトムと話し合わないと。
english: Someone needs to talk to Tom about what happened.

japanese: 誰がそんなことをするっていうんだ？
english: Why would anybody do something like that?

japanese: 彼の部屋に誰も入れてはなりません。
english: Don't let anyone in his room.

japanese: 弱いものいじめはよせ、このごろつきめが！
english: Pick on somebody your own size, you bully.

japanese: あたりには誰もいないようだ。
english: There doesn't seem to be anyone around.

japanese: どなたかにお手伝いいただければ、助かります。
english: If anyone here can help us, we'd appreciate it.

japanese: ここにいる誰かが手伝ってくれると、嬉しいんだけど。
english: If anyone here can help us, we'd appreciate it.

japanese: その件については誰も話したがらない。
english: Nobody wants to talk about that.

japanese: 手をあげて出て来い。
english: Come out with your hands up.

japanese: 水分と栄養しっかり摂って、早く元気になってね。
english: Be sure to eat right and have lots of liquids. I hope you get well soon!

japanese: 水分と栄養しっかり摂って、早く治してね。
english: Make sure you drink plenty of fluids and nourish yourself and get better soon.

japanese: このタブレット、言うこと聞いてくれないんです。
english: This tablet isn't picking up on what I am saying.

japanese: タンパに住みたいです。
english: I want to live in Tampa.

japanese: タンパで暮らしてみたい。
english: I want to live in Tampa.

japanese: トムはソファに座って雑誌を読んでいる。
english: Tom is sitting on the sofa, reading a magazine.

japanese: 他に誰かいるの？
english: Is there anyone else?

japanese: そこに誰かいますか？
english: Is there anyone there?

japanese: トム以外はみんな笑った。
english: Everyone laughed except for Tom.

japanese: 「今日すごくいいサイト見つけたんだ。タトエバ・プロジェクトっていうんだけど」「タトエバならもう10年前から知ってるし投稿してるよ」
english: "I discovered a great website today. It's called the 'Tatoeba project', if you're interested." "If you're talking about 'Tatoeba', I've already known about it and have been making submissions for 10 years!"

japanese: あの人たち早口ね。
english: They speak quickly.

japanese: トムのそばにいたい者なんていやしないさ。
english: Nobody wants to be around Tom.

japanese: あなたはたくさんの質問をします。
english: You do ask a lot of questions.

japanese: 本当にたくさん質問するね。
english: You do ask a lot of questions.

japanese: 個人的なことをお伺いしてもよろしいですか？
english: Would you mind if I ask you a personal question?

japanese: 部屋には他に誰かがいたの？
english: Was there someone else in the room?

japanese: 「どうして靴下っていつも片一方だけなくなるんだろう？」「両方なくなったらなくなったことに気づかないんだよ」「あ、そっか」
english: "I wonder why you always lose just one sock out of a pair." "If you lost both, you wouldn't notice it, right?" "Yeah, I guess you're right."

japanese: 「トム、寝たふりしてるでしょ」「してない。寝てる」「寝てる人は答えないはずだよ」
english: "Tom, you're pretending to be asleep, aren't you?" "No, I'm asleep." "A sleeping person shouldn't be able to answer, you know?"

japanese: 今日は朝から寂しく雨が降っています。
english: It's been cool and raining since morning today.

japanese: トム！サンドイッチ持ってきて。
english: Tom! Bring me a sandwich.

japanese: ボストンへ３回行ったことがある。
english: I've been to Boston three times.

japanese: トムは新しい家を買った。
english: Tom bought a new house.

japanese: トムが新しい家を買ったんだよ。
english: Tom bought a new house.

japanese: トムはその本を買う必要なかった。
english: Tom didn't need to buy that book.

japanese: パーティー来ればよかったのに。
english: You should've come to the party.

japanese: ごめんの一言くらい言えよ。
english: At least say you are sorry.

japanese: 言いたいことあるならさっさと言えよ！
english: If you have something you want to say, hurry up and say it!

japanese: お前ほんとに救いようのないバカだな。
english: You are really a hopeless idiot, aren't you?

japanese: 『トムとメアリー』は本当に救いようのない駄作だった。
english: "Tom and Mary" was truly an irredeemable piece of trash.

japanese: 『トムとメアリー』は最後まで救いのない暗い話だった。
english: All the way to the end, "Tom and Mary" was a hopeless and depressing story.

japanese: トム、懸垂何回できる？
